intro: Geissorhiza malmesburiensis, commonly known as the Malmesbury lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tall spikes of colorful, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand dry conditions. The flowers bloom in spring and are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
